questions.question_text: A junior administrator reported that the website used for anti-malware updates is not working. The senior administrator then discovered all requests to the anti-malware site are being redirected to a malicious site. Which of the following tools should the senior administrator check FIRST to identify the potential cause of the issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Sniffer

Explanation:
A sniffer is used to capture and analyze network packets exchanged between the client and the server during the request to the anti-malware site.

A. Data loss prevention
Data loss prevention (DLP) tools are used to prevent unauthorized disclosure of sensitive information.

B. File integrity monitor
File integrity monitoring (FIM) tools are used to monitor changes to files and file systems for signs of tampering or unauthorized modifications.

C. Port scanner
A port scanner is a tool used to scan a range of IP addresses and ports to identify open ports and services on a network.

Selected Answer: D
For me this is sniffer. You need to see where traffic is coming and going from.

questions.question_text: A technician is deploying a new workstation. The workstation uses DHCP and can ping other devices on the same VLAN, but it cannot access anything on a different VLAN. Which of the following steps should the technician perform NEXT?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Examine the DHCP scope configuration.

DHCP provides important network settings such as IP address, subnet mask, and default gateway.
If you are able to communicate within the same VLAN, it is likely that the basic IP settings are correct.
If you are unable to access a different VLAN, then there may be a problem with the default gateway or routing settings.

Selected Answer: C
C. Examine the DHCP scope configuration

Selected Answer: C
C. Examine the DHCP scope configuration.
If you don't have correct routing info then you won't be able to get out of your network.

questions.question_text: A server administrator is gathering business requirements to determine how frequently backups need to be performed on an application server. Which of the following is the administrator attempting to establish?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. RPO

RPO stands for Recovery Point Objective. It refers to the maximum tolerable amount of data loss measured in time. In this scenario, the server administrator is gathering business requirements to determine how frequently backups need to be performed on an application server. This directly relates to establishing the RPO, as it helps determine the frequency of backups necessary to meet the organization's data recovery objectives.

The RPO helps define the acceptable amount of data that may be lost during a disaster or failure scenario. By understanding the business requirements and the RPO, the administrator can set up backup schedules and strategies accordingly to ensure that data can be recovered within the desired time frame.

The recovery point objective (RPO) is the age of files that must be recovered from backup storage for normal operations to resume if a computer, system or network goes down as a result of a hardware, program or communications failure.

questions.question_text:
The network's IDS is giving multiple alerts that unauthorized traffic from a critical application server is being sent to a known-bad public IP address.
One of the alerts contains the following information:


Exploit Alert -

Attempted User Privilege Gain -
2/2/07-3:09:09 10.1.200.32 --> 208.206.12.9:80

This server application is part of a cluster in which two other servers are also servicing clients. The server administrator has verified the other servers are not sending out traffic to that public IP address. The IP address subnet of the application servers is 10.1.200.0/26. Which of the following should the administrator perform to ensure only authorized traffic is being sent from the application server and downtime is minimized? (Choose two.)

choices.E: Enable GPO to install an antivirus on all the servers and perform a weekly reboot.
choices.F: Perform an antivirus scan on all servers within the cluster and reboot each server.
choices.C: Block access to 208.206.12.9 from all servers on the network.
choices.D: Change the IP address of all the servers in the cluster to the 208.206.12.0/26 subnet.
choices.B: Perform a vulnerability scan on all the servers within the cluster and patch accordingly.
choices.A: Disable all services on the affected application server.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
B. Perform a vulnerability scan on all the servers within the cluster and patch accordingly.
C. Block access to 208.206.12.9 from all servers on the network.

Selected Answer: BC
Provided answers are correct. Find and fix the issue B. Perform a vulnerability scan on all the servers within the cluster and patch accordingly. Then take action for that not to be possible to occur again C. Block access to 208.206.12.9 from all servers on the network.

questions.question_text: A technician has been tasked to install a new CPU. Prior to the installation, the server must be configured. Which of the following should the technician update?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. The BIOS

When installing a new CPU, technicians should update the BIOS.
By updating the BIOS, it is expected that the new CPU will be properly recognized and the system will operate correctly.

Selected Answer: B
B. The BIOS
